bwwExcerpt: "The artist can be forgiven anything if he produces great art," says one of Woody Allen's proxies (and let's face it, they're all proxies) in Bullets Over Broadway. The maxim is aimed at grossly idealistic playwright David Shayne (Zach Braff), whose Broadway debut is being bankrolled by trigger-happy mobsters. At the time that Allen's original movie came out-when news of his unseemly personal life was making headlines-the sentiment gained added resonance. Now it's 20 years later and Bulletshas r
